job_title: Critical Care Technician in Jackson Hole, WY
pros: The staff is supportive, gracious, and full of wisdom - they are always willing to teach. It feels like a safe environment where the focus is always how we can be collectively doing better (for patients, for other staff, for the community, etc). The facility has been an amazing launchpad for me as a new EMT to learn the ins and outs of a hospital that handles a wide variety of cases.
cons: It's a con of the valley, not just the hospital...living here is tough! The turnover can be hard to watch as staff needs to leave to better accommodate budgets and cost of living in JH.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Jackson Hole, WY
pros: I have a solid team that supports one another. Benefits are good- though the price continues to rise Work from home
cons: The pay is the lowest in town, yet mentally exhausting. You used to be able to get a pay raise because you deserved it, now it's pulling teeth and you're getting pennies. They have raised the premiums without raising pay, except for the ceo- they could manage to pay 200k more from the last one (3 ceos in the last 2 years, yikes!) The admin doesn't value or appreciate you and they expect you to over work yourself because volume continues to rise, but won't approve more hires.

review_title: Good place to work, pay was on the low end
cons: Pay wasn't off the charts, Jackson is expensive
- Politics of working in a Hospital

job_title: Registered Nurse in Jackson Hole, WY
pros: This is a great place to work - your team is kind and feels like family and the admin seems to really care about us.
cons: This is a small rural hospital so you have to where a lot of hats sometimes.

job_title: ER Technician Level II in Jackson, WY
pros: good benefits, quality coworkers, solid providers
cons: upper management is sub-par, do not feel valued

review_title: Has a lot  of potential but...
job_title: Clinical Social Worker in North Hills, CA
pros: - small hospital and easily engaging with medical team
cons:
- leadership not supportive or understanding of SW role. 
-Does not pay well
- no union

review_title: Used to be a decent place to work
cons: For a nonprofit hospital, the people at the top are making a lot of money and putting a lot of pressure on the people at the bottom to bill for services. Doesn’t seem right

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: friendly environment, third party company, encouraging team.
cons: high turnover, new management, and unwilling higher superiors

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Tulsa, OK
pros: most of the staff was very nice, pretty decent benefits, and flexible hours
cons: Working night shift there is no management, so you are on your own

job_title: Cardiac Monitor Technician in Bartlesville, OK
pros: Great people. Good pay. Good benefits.
cons: Sweeps issues under the rug instead of facing them head on and doing better.

review_title: Good company to work for in WY
job_title: Manager Clinics in Jackson Hole, WY
pros: Not much work pressure. easy life
cons: Not much competition, or focus on future

job_title: Front-Office Supervisor in Santa Monica, CA

pros: Nice work site, good benefits, pay for continuing education,
cons: Unfair posting process, management does not follow Employee Handbook rules, Human Resource  leadership weak and does not advocate for Employees, No real process in place for Employees to express concerns, Management truly does not want to hear or respond to feedback, No real process for Employee relations resolutions, Management will retaliate against employees who question processes.  The work place seems to churn and burn employees

review_title: Quality care for patients but needs increased rights for staff
job_title: Registered Nurse in Jackson Hole, WY
pros: Jackson is a beautiful location and you have great coworkers.
cons: SJH does not provide adequate pay for the cost of living. It is a right to o work state and it shows. Employees do not have a unified voice and the Administration takes advantage of this fact. During difficult monetary times staff members’ benefits are the first thing cut. Which is frustrating when money is spent on other expenses such as rebranding.

review_title: A great place to work for folks who love the outdoors and living in a small community.
job_title: Director of Social Services in Jackson Hole, WY
pros: Excellent group of professionals in a small medical center dedicated to optimizing quality of life for community members.
cons:
Cost of living in the area
In-fighting between CEO and board members
Management's belief that pay is competitive when it really isn't.

job_title: Central Scheduler in Jackson Hole, WY
pros: The health benefits are above average.
cons: Nepotism, feminism, and unrealistic work loads. Very little training to work from. Feedback for performance is inconsistent, you will be fine one week and fired the next for the same work. Unless you are a desperate single mom from the area do not bother applying. Males need not apply.
